meaningMnemonic: The kanji means <kanji>promise</kanji>, but the meaning of this word is <vocabulary>about</vocabulary>, which is a little different. Just think about promises. When you promise something you really need to follow through... but only about as much as you need to for the other person to be happy. Someone asks for a puppy for Christmas, and you get them a stuffed animal puppy. It's <vocabulary>approximately</vocabulary> the promise you made. Close enough. *wink*
readingMnemonic: The reading for this is actually the same one that you learned with the kanji, so no need to memorize anything new!
